title: The Countdown
outcome: A concealed failsafe triggers a two-week countdown to total BCI shutdown unless a new protocol is agreed by Council and neighborhoods. Panic pushes cross-group leaders like Oksana, Lenart, and Rada to collaborate using assemblies and public debate. They produce a radically inclusive charter just before the deadline, fundamentally transforming Stenograd's governance. Halden's death is reframed as careful preparation for collective self-rule, not loss of control.

events.description: A dormant failsafe activates in the BCI: a visible two-week countdown to total system shutdown unless a new protocol gathers broad support.
Citywide public forums spring up, with diverse groups drafting possible new governance models. Tensions run high; panic and hope coexist.
Oksana, Lenart, and Rada assemble a consensus protocol—score amnesty, rotating neighborhood leadership, and transparent rules—after long debate and heavy pressure.

The new protocol is published and accepted with minutes to spare; BCI restrictions vanish and assemblies step in as interim authority. Halden’s final note is revealed, confirming this transition as his purpose all along.
